sentences.en: He laughed it off with aristocratic indifference.
sentences.cn: 他带着贵族式的漠然对其一笑置之。

sentences.en: His ideal was a conception of high prosperity and property of the aristocratic life.
sentences.cn: 他的理想是飞黄腾达,阔绰体面,过贵族式的生活.

sentences.en: His manner was aristocratic , his movements dapper and suave.
sentences.cn: 他气宇轩昂, 温文尔雅,举止潇洒.

sentences.en: Of course you're the most aristocratic of the two of us.
sentences.cn: 你当然是我们两个人中最有贵族气派的.

sentences.en: Rather their organization was aristocratic with leading families which kept each other in order.
sentences.cn: 他们的组织其实由贵族统治,各个重要家庭等级分明,井然有序.

sentences.en: She comes from an aristocratic family.

sentences.cn: 她装出一副贵族的样子.

sentences.en: She had an impeccable aristocratic pedigree.
She was of ( an ) aristocratic lineage.
sentences.cn: 她 有 贵族的血统.

sentences.en: That son of peasants radiated a natural dignity and aristocratic bearing.
sentences.cn: 这个农民的儿子显示出一种天生的尊严和贵族的神态.

sentences.en: The Duke was tall, broodshouldered , aristocratic looking.
sentences.cn: 衍圣公是个身材高大, 肩膀宽阔, 相貌堂堂的人.

sentences.en: The heroes and heroines are of ancient and aristocratic lineage.
sentences.cn: 男女主人都是家世渊源的贵族.

sentences.en: There is another form of wilful obscurity that masquerades as aristocratic exclusiveness.
sentences.cn: 还有一种故意造成的含糊其词,用以掩盖其贵族老爷式的孤傲态度.

sentences.en: This was what came of early indulgence, and insolence, and extravagance, and aristocratic airs.
sentences.cn: 这是由于他从小娇生惯养, 目中无人, 穷奢极欲, 摆贵族架子的结果.

words.tran_cn: 贵族；贵族统治；上层社会；贵族政治
高贵的,有贵族血统的,贵族式的

trans.tran_en: belonging to or typical of the aristocracy
